file_content.text: I'm getting assigned to a field unit to handle this ship business. Finally!
So, you all made it back in one piece.
So, you made it back in one piece.
Looks like you saw some action, though; good for you. I got to polish a chair in a protocol seminar.
We'd like the Republic's help, ensuring a dangerous Sith ship stays lost in the marshes. This message will explain.
Padawan Qualie sent a message.
The Jedi have asked for help, making sure a dangerous Sith ship stays lost in the marshes.
Padawan Qualie sent a message.
Action? I'd say so.
Great. What's that datapad, is that for me?
How would you like to coordinate the sinking of a dangerous Sith starship out in Gormak-infested wilderness?
Fancy a new assignment?
What? Let me see that datapad.
An armed Sith starship? Right next door to the shrine? Wow. This... we got real lucky. I'd better start making calls.
Here--this is for you. It's the least we owe you, for keeping this thing away from the Gormak.
It was no trouble at all.
It wasn't so terrible.
I won't say "no" to a reward.
Thanks again. And, good luck. It might be peaceful on Voss, but out there--anything but.
At least you're in for a straight fight. Good luck.
Good to see we're putting on a strong show for the local Imps. I hear you've given them a hiding.
Excuse me--Master Jedi? Sorry, I just have to ask.
I heard you made it to Dromund Kaas, right under the Empire's nose. Is that true?
Did you really take a Mystic through that wilderness? Without an army?
'Scuse me, Major, I've got to know. Did you really finish off Lord Torius? Without all those reserve forces?
Well. Here's the infamous captain who got a death sentence and a pardon, all in one day.
Sorry. I've got to ask. Did you really go into those Nightmare Lands? And you're still... you?
Incredible. And I'm stuck here in "advisory capacity." I get to tiptoe through this week's diplomatic crisis--lucky me.
Show the Republic at its best, and you'll do more for our cause on Voss than any act of heroism.
Focus on setting an example.
If you'd heard the reports we're getting, Master Jedi, you'd want to be out there.
A reliance on words, rather than violence, is the basis of civilization.
Diplomacy's always worthwhile.
Still, I'll hang on to my blaster. Especially now.
It's hard to just watch those Imperials strut around--like the Sacking of Coruscant never happened.
The Imps are the worst part.
You want to work off that frustration, sir?
Throw a punch at someone deserving, ignore anyone who yells and everything'll turn out fine. Works for me.
Tiptoeing's no fun. Be bold!
You're crazy. That might be just what we need.
I can't help being needed.
I can't help being needed.
Huh. We could really use some of that talent.
There's Republic soldiers on Ord Mantell and Balmorra who are tiptoeing through minefields.
You don't know just how lucky.
And I'd rather be there, sir, but my bosses need a military liaison.
Voss is no picnic either, but my bosses need a military liaison.
The Gormak are moving an invasion force into the Pelath-Ri Marches, a stone's throw from the Shrine of Healing.
We had a bunch of research camps there, excavating the local ruins. The Gormak swarmed them. Our researchers... they barely had a blaster between them.
There must be a way to force the Gormak out of that region.
Can we repel the Gormak?
Sounds like we need more Republic boots on the ground.
Are we sending an army?
We're mobilizing people now, but there's a problem.
That's terrible news.
The Gormak attack everyone--outsiders, Voss, anyone with a scrap of technology they want.
Gormak attacks aren't new.
True, but raising such a large force? Definitely new.
There's a Jedi Master out there, Master Halykus--maybe you've met.
There's a Jedi Master out there, Master Halykus. He was one of the researchers.
This Master Halykus thinks the Gormak are looking for something. Something worth raising an army to find.
What could the Gormak want so badly?
Like what?
I don't know; it's Master Halykus's theory.
I want to help out.
I'm losing interest, here.
There's an army of Gormak, within marching distance of the Shrine of Healing, and... you don't care? At all?
Maybe I could do something....
Okay, fine, I'll help out.
I can get you a speeder to Camp Thesh. That's where Master Halykus took most of the survivors.
He should know more, about what the Gormak are up to. And how to send them packing.
Not really. [Refuse quest]
No. [Refuse quest]
So much for heroes.
I'm afraid to touch anything around here. It's like even the trash is sacred.
